snippet: Julian Onderdonk, renowned for his Texas bluebonnet landscapes, painted under pseudonyms while working in New York, the author of a new book suggests.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; new book suggests Julian Onderdonk, renowned for his Texas bluebonnet landscapes, painted under pseudonyms while working in New York; Spirit Stones: The Ancient Art of the Scholar’s Rock (Abbeville), documents about 200 pieces of gnarled rock formations that belong to stones dealer Kemin Hu.
lead_paragraph: Julian Onderdonk, renowned for his Texas bluebonnet landscapes, painted under pseudonyms while working in New York, the author of a new book suggests.

headline.main: A Texas Painter Worked Under the Radar in New York
headline.print_headline: Historians’ Book Reveals a Texan’s Noms de Brush
